meanings.definition: The condition of being full or complete.
meanings.sent1: The plenitude of joy on her face was evident to everyone.
meanings.sent2: The plenitude of food at the party made everyone happy.
meanings.sent3: His plenitude of excuses for being late was amusing to his friends.
meanings.sent4: The plenitude of stars in the night sky took her breath away.
meanings.sent5: The plenitude of colors in the painting made it truly beautiful.

meanings.sent1: The plenitude of books on the shelf was overwhelming.
meanings.sent2: She was grateful for the plenitude of water during the drought.
meanings.sent3: The plenitude of toys in the store excited the children.
meanings.sent4: The plenitude of knowledge in the library opened up new possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The plenitude of flowers in the garden brought a smile to her face.

meanings.definition: The state of being abundant or plentiful.
meanings.sent1: The plenitude of apples on the tree was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent2: They were amazed by the plenitude of fish in the river.
meanings.sent3: The plenitude of jokes he told always made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: In her eyes, the plenitude of love was all that mattered.
meanings.sent5: The plenitude of opportunities in the city drew people from far and wide.
